body_html:
Hi, my program uses TensorFlow C++ API, and address sanitizer has found a memory leak in my program that I believe is related to this issue.

The leaked memory found by address sanitizer is allocated by
tensorflow::thread::ThreadPool::ThreadPool(tensorflow::Env*, tensorflow::ThreadOptions const&, std::string const&, int, bool), which is called by TF_NewSession.

I hope this issue can be fixed soon. Thanks!
body_text:
Hi, my program uses TensorFlow C++ API, and address sanitizer has found a memory leak in my program that I believe is related to this issue.
The leaked memory found by address sanitizer is allocated by
tensorflow::thread::ThreadPool::ThreadPool(tensorflow::Env*, tensorflow::ThreadOptions const&, std::string const&, int, bool), which is called by TF_NewSession.
I hope this issue can be fixed soon. Thanks!
body:
Hi, my program uses TensorFlow C++ API, and address sanitizer has found a memory leak in my program that I believe is related to this issue.

The leaked memory found by address sanitizer is allocated by
`tensorflow::thread::ThreadPool::ThreadPool(tensorflow::Env*, tensorflow::ThreadOptions const&, std::string const&, int, bool)`, which is called by `TF_NewSession`.

I hope this issue can be fixed soon. Thanks!
